result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Amanda M Hinzman in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF173, 15CF266,15CF303, 15CF561, 15TR725, 15TR1263, 15TR1264 and 15TR1448 

15CF173: 
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and 3. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Counts 2 and 4 dismissed and read in. 
Court orders PSI on count 1. Bond continues. 
Court orders on count 3 : 
$811.50
6 month drivers license revocation
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

15CF266: 
Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Court orders PSI. Bond continues.  Sentencing scheduled 4/5/16 at 1:30-2:30 PM. 

15CF303: 
State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants. 

15CF561: 
State moves to dimiss and read-in. Court grants. 

15TR725: State moves to dimiss and read-in. Court grants. 
15TR1263 & 15TR1264: State moves to dimiss and read-in. Court grants. 
15TR1448: State moves to dimiss and read-in. Court grants. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

AMENDED 12/21/15:  $1000.00 Cash Bond amended to $2,500.00 Signature Bond.  Defendant must not leave the State of Wisconsin without the Court's permission.  All previously ordered conditions remain in full force and effect.

15CF561 - Defendant Amanda M Hinzman in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Amanda M Hinzman in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:19 Adam Steffen, Police Officer with the Turtle Lake Police Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
State requests the court take judicial notice of the felony bail bond attached to the criminal complaint. Court takes judicial notice of the bond attached to the criminal complaint. 
3:22 Cross by Defense. 
3:24 Testimony closed. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
Defense requests bond modification from a $1000.00 cash bond to a signature bond. State does not object. Court orders the bond be amended from a $1000.00 cash bond to a $2500.00 signature bond with the condition must not leave the state of wisconsin without the court's permission.  Arraignment scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Amanda M Hinzman in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Amanda M Hinzman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
